intro: Hieracium thyrsoideum, commonly known as the tall hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and ray florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, with erect, hairy stems and basal leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a single head, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium thyrsoideum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates.
